summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, denying motions to quash a subpoena and ordering the Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program to produce materials to the court. The order also directs the parties to negotiate a protective order for reviewing the materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20-CR-330) who issued a Rule 17(c)(3) subpoena that is the subject of this order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge who issued this order denying motions to quash and setting deadlines for production and protective order negotiation.

persons.name: Administrator Feldman
persons.role: Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
persons.context: The administrator who filed a motion to quash the defendant's subpoena and requested oral argument, which was denied by the court.

connections.description: Maxwell issued a subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program administered by Feldman, who moved to quash it.
Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case and issued this order regarding her subpoena.
Judge Nathan denied Feldman's motion to quash and request for oral argument, ordering production of materials.

events.title: Court Order on Subpoena Motions
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan denied motions to quash Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 17(c)(3) subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program and set deadlines for production and protective order negotiation.

events.title: Deadline for Production and Protective Order
events.description: The Administrator must produce responsive materials to the court by 12:00 p.m., and the parties must submit a proposed protective order for court approval by the same deadline.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court denied motions to quash Ghislaine Maxwell's subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, ordering production of responsive materials.
The Administrator of the program (Feldman) must produce materials to the court via electronic thumb drive by November 24, 2021, at 12:00 p.m.
The court ordered the parties to negotiate and submit a protective order for reviewing the materials by the same deadline.
The court indicated it will determine whether the parties may inspect the materials and whether a protective order is necessary.
This order shows ongoing legal battles over access to evidence from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program during Maxwell's criminal trial.
